title: Boy wounded in accidental shooting
content:
A 16-year-old Rocky Mount boy was wounded Sunday when the handgun he was reportedly handling accidentally discharged.
Terrence Adrian Battle Jr. received non-life threatening injuries and was transported to Nash UNC Health Care after the incident that occurred at about 6:20 p.m. Sunday on the 400 block of Ambler Avenue.
Rocky Mount police Cpl. Mike Lewis said no charges have been filed in connection with the incident so far but the matter is still under investigation. Lewis also said the event serves as a reminder of the importance of gun safety.
“Citizens need to careful to obey laws about the use and storage of guns,” Lewis said. “They should also always be conscious of safety when handling guns.”
